localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Additional composition metadata options for EHR.Network to cover for what is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
A term/number specifying the level of confidentiality of the Document. A number which can be mapped to the access control permissions
Name of theplatform tenant through which the data has been recorded
ID of theplatform tenant through which the data has been recorded
Name of the application that created the composition
Registration id of the committing application
A group of observations that are recorded at the same time and record the physical measurement and proportions of a person
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.  Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.
Any timed measurement of height or body length.
The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Comment about the measurement of body height/length.
Position of individual when measured.
Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.
Length is measured in a fully extended, recumbent position with the pelvis flat, legs extended and feet flexed.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The weight of the individual.
Additional narrative about the measurement of Body weight, not captured in other fields.
Description of the state of dress of the person at the time of weighing.
Without any clothes.
Wearing only a nappy - which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which will not add to weight significantly.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight, including shoes.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body weight eg timing in menstrual cycle, timing of recent bowel motion or noting of amputation.

Usually the first weight, measured soon after birth. This event will only be used once per health record
.
The weight of the individual.
Additional narrative about the measurement of Body weight, not captured in other fields.
Description of the state of dress of the person at the time of weighing.
Without any clothes.
Wearing only a nappy - which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which will not add to weight significantly.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight, including shoes.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body weight eg timing in menstrual cycle, timing of recent bowel motion or noting of amputation.
The measured or calculated surface area of a human body.

annotations.comment: May also be referred to as BSA.

localizedDescriptions.en: The measured or calculated surface area of a human body.
Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.
Record of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement or calculation of body surface area.

annotations.comment: For example: noting limb amputation; or skin diseases.

localizedDescriptions.en: The method by which the body surface area was entered into the clinical system.
The Area was entered automatically by the clinical system and without manual intervention of the clinician.
The Area was entered manually by the clinician.
Formula used to calculate the BSA.

annotations.comment: For example: Mosteller, DuBois and DuBois, Haycock and Boyd.

localizedDescriptions.en: The Dubois and Dubois formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Mosteller formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Haycock formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Gehan and George formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Boyd formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Fujimoto formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The Takihara formula was used to calculate the body surface area.
The measurement of the circumference of the arms.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the distance around the waist just above the hip bone.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the waist circumference not captured in other fields.
Narrative descripiton of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.
The measurement of the circumference of the chest of an individual.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the distance around the waist just above the hip bone.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the waist circumference not captured in other fields.
Narrative descripiton of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.
The measurement of the distance around the waist just above the hip bone.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the distance around the waist just above the hip bone.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the waist circumference not captured in other fields.
Narrative descripiton of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.
The measurement of the distance around the hips.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the distance around the widest point of the hip and buttocks.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken at the widest point of the hips/buttocks.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the hip circumference not captured in other fields.
The measurement of the circumference of the thighs.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the distance around the waist just above the hip bone.

annotations.comment: The measurement is usually taken just above the hip bone.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the waist circumference not captured in other fields.
Narrative descripiton of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.
The measurement of the longest distance around the head.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The measurement of the longest distance around the head.
Additional narrative about the head circumference not captured in other fields.
The first measurement of head circumference that is recorded soon after birth. This event should only be used once per record.
The measurement of the longest distance around the head.
Additional narrative about the head circumference not captured in other fields.
Calculated measurement which compares a person's weight and height.
Any timed recording of Body Mass Index.
Index describing ratio of weight to height.
The method of entering the Body Mass Index.
Body Mass Index calculated and entered automatically without user intervention.
Body Mass Index calculated and entered directly by user.
Formula used to derive the Body Mass Index.
Comment about the Body Mass Index measurement eg noting that the measurements used were adjusted weight/height.
The ratio of the circumference of the waist to the circumference of the hips.
Default, unspecified point in time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Ratio with unitary denominator.
Additional narrative about the ratio not captured in other fields.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
